All Classes

Class Description
AbstractBoard
Represents the game board in which card can be added to a given position
AbstractShapeUpGame
Represent the operation of the game with all the actions to be done to play one game.
AddFont
Font initializer, simply load the font file in the resources folder
AdvancedShapeUpGameController
Controller for the game used in the advanced mode The main changes are here when the card are draw since in the rules the card are drawn at the end of a turn and not at the beginning.
BoardEmptyException
Exception thrown when the user try to remove something from an empty board
Card
Represents a card from the Game A card is made of a color, a shape and if its filled or not.
Card.Color
The color of the card can be red, green or blue
Card.Filling
A card can be filled or not (hollow).
Card.Shape
The shape of the card can be a triangle, a circle or a square
CardWithScreenCoordinates
Represent a card and its screen coordinates Coordinates are represented in the java.swing way (e.g.
Choice
Lists the 3 possibilities of choice for a player in each turn: he can move, place or end his turn.
ChoiceOrder
Lists the 2 steps when a player plays one turn.
CircleBoard
Represent a circle game board, one of the different shapes for the game.
CircleBoardTest
Test for circle board by checking different cards' arrangement (oriented, non oriented, full...)
ConsoleInputReadTask
A console input read task is a console reader that can be interrupted.
Coordinates
The class represents mere 2D coordinates with an abscissa (x) and an ordinate (y).
CoordinatesConvertor
Convertor for coordinates Used to convert coordinates from their screen coordinates to their board ones This use the size of the cards, the offset between cards, the shape of the board (for the circle one that needs to be shifted in a particular way)
CoordinatesTest
Test for smallest/biggest abscissa/ordinates method
DifficultStrategy
Represents a difficult strategy.
DifficultStrategyTest
Test for special case of the difficult strategy (virtual player) Theses test are mainly limit test (for a almost full or empty and almost empty board)
EndGameScoreDrawer
Draws the end game score using Graphics2D Scores are here strings that are drawn with the loaded font, with different colors
EndRoundScoreDrawer
Draws the end round score using Graphics2D Scores, players names and round number are here strings that are drawn with the loaded font, with different colors
GameConsoleView
Console implementation of GameView
GameController
Represent a game controller in the MVC pattern the controller is thus an entry point for the view that can calls its method
GameMode
Represent the game mode for the InitController
GameState
Lists all the states where game goes.
GameView
Represents a view of the game (View of the MVC pattern)
IBoardVisitor
Represent the score calculator in which we start a method based on the shape of the game and the Victory Card.
InitConsoleView
Console implementation of InitView
InitController
Controller for initiation (Launch menu, settings for the game...) using 2 views (intended to be a console and hmi one)
InitFrameView
Represents the initialization view in HMI.
InitModel
Allow to manage the initialization with a state machine.
InitState
Lists all states of the initialization menu.
InitView
Represents a view of the initialization (View of the MVC pattern)
MoveRequest
Represents a move request from a player.
MoveRequestResult
Lists all possible cases after making a move request.
MyButton
Custom JButton, used to handle hover and pressed image in an easier way
PlaceRequest
Represents a place request from a player.
PlaceRequestResult
Lists all possible cases after making a place request.
Player
Represents a player with all his characteristics and his actions.
PlayerHandEmptyException
Represents an exception when the hand of one player is empty without explainations.
PlayerStrategy
Represents actions that can be done by a Player and defines virtual player's strategy.
RandomStrategy
Represents a random strategy.
RealPlayer
Represents a real player.
RectangleBoard
Represent a rectangle game board, one of the different shapes for the game.
RectangleBoardTest
Test for the rectangle board, we cover several case: Case 1: the board has 2 row and 4 columns Case 2: the board has 2 column and 5 rows Case 3: the board has 3 columns and 3 rows Case 4: the board has 2 columns and 2 rows
ScoreCalculatorVisitor
Represent one of the different variants to calculate the score for the game.
ScoreCalculatorVisitorTest
Case 1: the board is horizontal and has 15 cards Case 2: the board is vertical and has 15 cards Case 3: the board is vertical and has 14 cards with a hole in the right down corner Case 4: the board is horizontal and has 14 cards with a hole in the board's middle Case 5: the board is not vertical and not horizontal (3*3) Case 6: the board is not vertical and not horizontal (2*2) Case 7: the board has only one Card
ScoreCalculatorWithBonusVisitor
Represent one of the different variants to calculate the score for the game.
ScoreDrawer
UI class Use to display the score and the associated rainbow title
ShapeUpGame
Represents the normal mode of the game.
ShapeUpGameAdvanced
Represents the advanced mode of the game.
ShapeUpGameController
This class represent a game controller in the shape up game It is intended to work with 2 views (more precisely a console and a hmi one) and implements therefore a lock system which allow to play using both view in a concurrent way.
ShapeUpGameTest
Tests for shape up game class covers play turn (place, move), card draw during different moments of the game
ShapeUpGameWithoutAdjacencyRule
Represents the no adjacency mode of the game.
SpriteSplitter
Split the needed sprites for the SwingHmiView The sprites are located in the resources folder
SwingHmiView
Game view using swing hmi this view is based on the Observer pattern, it basically receives events in the propertyChange method and then display and set the correct listener accordingly.
TriangleBoard
Represent a triangle game board, one of the different shapes for the game.
TriangleBoardTest
Test every case of the triangle board A case is a orientation of the right-angled triangle (thus where the right angled is located (top left, top right, bottom left, bottom right)
VirtualPlayer
Represents a virtual player (It uses a predefined strategy: random or difficult).
VirtualPlayerTest
Tests for virtual player Here we test the different strategies (difficult and random) for placement and movement
